parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate by name or affiliation.  While the advertiser, Mihai Polițeanu, is a public figure, the post itself doesn't mention any candidate participating in the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content addresses a public issue (illegal constructions and the responsibility of the company managing halls and markets).  The targeting parameters indicate a broad reach within Ploiești.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post appears to be to highlight a local issue concerning illegal constructions and to hold those responsible accountable. There is no explicit or implicit call to vote for or against any candidate in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Potentially True. The post could be considered a form of citizen journalism, reporting on a local issue of public interest. It presents a situation, alleges a problem, and calls for accountability. However, the lack of journalistic standards (e.g., verification of facts, multiple perspectives) weakens this argument.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Potentially True. The post could be interpreted as expressing Mihai Polițeanu's personal opinion on a local issue.  While it's a public statement, it doesn't directly advocate for or against any candidate in the parliamentary elections.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1088204942541669</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while paid for and published by a public figure, Mihai Polițeanu, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post focuses on a local issue concerning illegal constructions and accountability, not on influencing the outcome of the parliamentary elections.  There is no mention of any parliamentary candidate, nor is there a call to vote for or against any specific individual or party.  While the post is public and widely disseminated, its objective appears to be to address a local governance issue, not to promote a political campaign.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
